message: How does the PCDS 2030 plan aim to achieve social inclusivity for all Sarawakians, and what specific strategies or initiatives are outlined to support this goal?
response: Thinking… (click to collapse) I will research the PCDS 2030 plan's social inclusivity goals. Key constraints include limited information on specific strategies. Assuming the plan outlines initiatives for all Sarawakians, I'll look for details. I’ve performed an information search and found the following: The PCDS 2030 plan aims to achieve social inclusivity for all Sarawakians by implementing various strategies and initiatives. Some of the specific initiatives outlined in the plan include: Bantuan Khas Sarawakku Sayang (BKSS) packages: The Sarawak Government has implemented nine BKSS packages, totaling RM6.7 billion, to alleviate the financial burden of the people and businesses during the COVID-19 pandemic. These packages include cash assistance, discounts on utility bills, fee waivers, and deferment of payment for land premiums and loan schemes. Endowment Fund Sarawak (EFS): The EFS provides a grant of RM1,000 in the form of savings for every Sarawakian baby born starting from 2019, to assist with higher education, starting a career, or as seed capital for small businesses. Special Annual Grant for Early Childhood Education Institutions: The Special Annual Grant (GTK) is a grant of RM5,000 allocated to Early Childhood Education Institutions registered in Sarawak to provide quality care, guidance, and education. Kenyalang Gold Card: The Kenyalang Gold Card is a special card for Sarawak senior citizens aged 60 and above, providing facilities such as special discounts, free membership, and other benefits at strategic partner stores. Bantuan Pesakit Buah Pinggang: This initiative provides assistance to kidney patients, especially those from low-income groups, to ease their burden. Launching Grants for Entrepreneurs: The Sarawak Government provides economic opportunities to welfare aid recipients to join the entrepreneurial field by granting a launching grant of RM5,000. Female Head of Household Assistance (KIRWaS): KIRWaS is an initiative to provide assistance to single mothers and female heads of households from disadvantaged groups, in the form of cash amounting to RM500 for one household. Affordable Housing: The Sarawak Government has implemented various schemes to assist the public in owning affordable housing, such as Rancangan Perumahan Rakyat (RPR), Rumah Mampu Milik (RMM), and Rumah Spektra Permata (RSP).
